title: Problem deserializing Capella beacon states

labels.name: Epic Capella
labels.description: Issues required to implement Capella upgrade

body: ### Description It seems that Teku is unable to deserialize Capella beacon states that were generated from the consensus spec tests. I've spent a little bit of time trying to figure out the issue, but I'm having trouble. So here's everything I know so far. Am I doing this right? I would use `zcli` for comparison, but it doesn't support Capella yet. It works for Bellatrix states just fine: ``` $ teku debug-tools pp --network=minimal BELLATRIX BeaconState ~/Projects/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tests/minimal/bellatrix/operations/attestation/pyspec_tests/success/pre.ssz_snappy | head { "genesis_time" : "0", "genesis_validators_root" : "0x0a08c27fe4ece2483f9e581f78c66379a06f96e9c24cd1390594ff939b26f95b", "slot" : "1", "fork" : { "previous_version" : "0x01000001", "current_version" : "0x02000001", "epoch" : "0" }, "latest_block_header" : { ``` But when I change it to Capella (command arg & different file path), it fails: ``` $ teku debug-tools pp --network=minimal CAPELLA BeaconState ~/Projects/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tests/minimal/capella/operations/attestation/pyspec_tests/success/pre.ssz_snappy tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.ssz.sos.SszDeserializeException: First variable element offset doesn't match the end of fixed part at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.ssz.schema.impl.AbstractSszContainerSchema.sszDeserializeTree(AbstractSszContainerSchema.java:305) at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.ssz.schema.SszSchema.sszDeserialize(SszSchema.java:80) at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.ssz.schema.SszSchema.sszDeserialize(SszSchema.java:84) at tech.pegasys.teku.cli.subcommand.debug.PrettyPrintCommand.prettyPrint(PrettyPrintCommand.java:111) at tech.pegasys.teku.cli.subcommand.debug.PrettyPrintCommand.call(PrettyPrintCommand.java:104) at tech.pegasys.teku.cli.subcommand.debug.PrettyPrintCommand.call(PrettyPrintCommand.java:42) at picocli.CommandLine.executeUserObject(CommandLine.java:2041) at picocli.CommandLine.access$1500(CommandLine.java:148) at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.executeUserObjectOfLastSubcommandWithSameParent(CommandLine.java:2461) at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2453) at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2415) at picocli.CommandLine$AbstractParseResultHandler.execute(CommandLine.java:2273) at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.execute(CommandLine.java:2417) at picocli.CommandLine.execute(CommandLine.java:2170) at tech.pegasys.teku.cli.BeaconNodeCommand.parse(BeaconNodeCommand.java:265) at tech.pegasys.teku.Teku.start(Teku.java:63) at tech.pegasys.teku.Teku.startFromCLIArgs(Teku.java:86) at tech.pegasys.teku.Teku.main(Teku.java:40) ``` This Capella minimal beacon state (zipped so that GitHub will allow it): [pre.ssz_snappy.zip](https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/files/10211194/pre.ssz_snappy.zip) The relevant block of code: https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/blob/5bf7adeb071b1722a0d017ceaa3e3fd8c66d0867/infrastructure/ssz/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/infrastructure/ssz/schema/impl/AbstractSszContainerSchema.java#L304-L307 When debugging, I see that: * `variableChildrenOffsets.getInt(0)` is 10233 * `endOffset` is 19665 * `reader.getAvailableBytes()` is 9416 Teku expects the variable sized fields to start at offset 10233, but it actually starts at 10249, which is a difference of 16. `next_withdrawal_index` and `next_withdrawal_validator_index` (`fixedChildrenSubtrees` 17 and 18) seem wrong too:

Hmm I think I found the issue. In pyspec tests, if I print the state, it shows:

```
...
withdrawal_queue: List[Withdrawal, 1099511627776] = List[Withdrawal, 1099511627776]<<len=0>>()
next_withdrawal_index: WithdrawalIndex = 0
next_partial_withdrawal_validator_index: ValidatorIndex = 0
```

And `withdrawal_queue` definitely isn't supposed to be there. That's old.
Ah man. I accidentally generated these with an old version of consensus-specs... My bad.
